pros: Coming into a completely new role to what i have previously done, i was hesitant to start as i wasn't sure how long it'd take me to get to grips with the different systems. The team i worked within were so welcoming and always there to help me when needed, they made the transition easy and helped build my confidence quickly! Managerial support has been great throughout, regular catch ups, constructive criticism where needed but praised and encouraged. i always felt i could go to my manager with any issues i had, the support was great and was the kind of support you'd hope for from a manager. The facilities at the Derby Road site are great, lots of food options and car parking spaces have never been an issue. All staff are welcoming, regardless of if you are in the same team or not. highly recommend :)
cons: The spot salary was a drawback for me.

review_title: Good organisation to work for with staff benefits and varied job roles

cons: Workload Pay is limited due to being public funded

review_title: Not bad if you can handle change
pros: There are many fine, supportive colleagues. You can get counselling if needed. Flexible managers in some areas to keep work-life balance. Interesting opportunities come up. Annual leave package is very good.
cons: Not enough development qualifications offered for support staff. Development qualifications that are offered, you have to pay for. There is an overall feeling of anxiety due to recent restructures that make some people feel negatively about the company. Too many people saying that they are overloaded with work now that so many people have had to go.

pros: Decent working conditions, good pay, good annual leave entitlement
cons: Senior management are out of touch, lie to themselves and others, decisions can be very arbitrary

pros: There's a close, family-esque, environment, with everyone looking out for each other. Very friendly staff, all the way up to the job chain.
